intro: Schizocapsa plantaginea, commonly known as the broad-leaved sedge, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands or wetlands. Schizocapsa plantaginea plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
